intro: Nestronia cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nestronia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
